definition: variant of 心怦怦跳[xin1 peng1 peng1 tiao4]

sentences.chinese: 楼上有人在砰砰地走动。

sentences.english: Now the hall-boy pounded on the door and he released his hold upon her regretfully.
sentences.chinese: 这时旅馆的茶房把门敲得砰砰响，他遗憾地放开了她。

sentences.english: We took the lift to the lobby and heard bangs as the door opened.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐电梯到了前厅，门打开的时候听到砰砰的声音。

sentences.english: The shutters thumped the wall in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 在风中，百叶窗帘砰砰地碰着墙。

sentences.english: She banged off to her room.
sentences.chinese: 她砰砰地走回自己房间去了。

sentences.english: An engine was chugging but not delivering heat.
sentences.chinese: 一副引擎砰砰响着却不提供能量。

sentences.english: Someone is thundering at the door.
My heart was palpitating with fear.
Me. He reached out to me, and my heart thumped unsteadily.
sentences.chinese: 他伸出手够到我，我的心开始砰砰乱跳。

sentences.english: The next morning we wake to the thump of hooves.
sentences.chinese: 第二天清晨，砰砰的马蹄声把我们从睡梦中惊醒。

sentences.english: I banged on the door until he let me in.
sentences.chinese: 我砰砰地打门，直到他们让我进去。

sentences.english: Please don't pop all the ballons before the party starts.
sentences.chinese: 请不要在聚会开端前就把一切的气球都砰砰弄爆。

sentences.english: Some teenagers were popping balloons with darts.
sentences.chinese: 几个少年在用飞镖砰砰的扎气球。

sentences.english: You make loud bangs at the surface and listen to the returning echoes.
sentences.chinese: 您砰砰巨响在表面上，并听取返回的回声。

definition: Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
thumping sound (onom.)/to be eager and anxious (to do sth)/faithful and upright
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
(onom.) beating of the heart/pitapat/pulsation of a machine
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
